page.title: 19PUBLIC SERVICES IN GLADESTRY
page.content: Everybody in the area has electricity. It comes from the South Wales Electricity Board. There is no mains gas. If you want gas, you must buy it in cylinders, or have it brought by tanker. Half the people have mains water from Dwr Cymry(Welsh Water). The rest get their water from springs. Our police force is the Dyfed-Powys Police. They have to come from Knighton. Our firemen are from Powys Fire Service, but usually the Kington firemen from Herefodshire get here first. Ambulances come from Kington or Presteigne.For most services we have to go to Kington. The doctors, the hospital, the dentist, and the chemists are all there. If you need an operation you have to go to Hereford. For shops, banks, hairdressers, petrol we have to go Kington. Newspapers come to Gladestry shop or with the postman.
